entries.- หากทำครบ 3 ภารกิจ จะได้โบนัสเพิ่ม 20 B:
Raih Poin Brave (BP) dengan menyelesaikan Tugas Harian untuk ditukarkan dengan hadiah besar dan raih hadiah tonggak loyalitas!

- Tugas Harianmu setiap hari akan Disegarkan dengan 3 tugas baru
- Tugas yang tidak selesai dari hari sebelumnya akan dicabut
- Menyelesaikan semua tugas harian akan memberimu 20 BP bonus!
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_10000_1_DESCRIPTION:
Tap the Treasure Chest icon in the center-right section of the Home screen to go to the Gift reception screen.

If Gifts aren't received for more than 30 days, they will be deleted. Be sure to check for and receive Gifts regularly.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_10000_2_DESCRIPTION:
When changing devices, please perform a Data Transfer to transfer your current Brave Frontier play data.

To perform a transfer, go to Settings on the Menu, then tap Issue under Data Transfer.

After issuing a Transfer Code, start Brave Frontier on the new device, then perform the data transfer from either the Title screen or the Settings screen.

*After a Transfer Code is issued, perform the Data Transfer as soon as possible.
*After a Transfer Code is issued, you can still play Brave Frontier on your
current device until the transfer is complete.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1000_1_DESCRIPTION: This is where you pick up keys to unlock the Metal Parade and Jewel Parade that appear in the Vortex Gate.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1000_2_DESCRIPTION:
Keys given out at the Administration Office can be used to unlock the Metal Parade and Jewel Parade which appear in the Vortex Gate.
Each Parade requires its own special key to unlock, each of which are given out on specific days of the week. Be careful not to forget to receive yours.

Distribution times:
Metal Keys
Every Monday, Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday

Jewel Keys
Every Wednesday

*Keys are distributed at 5:00 a.m. each day.
*You can hold in stock a maximum of 10 of each key.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1000_3_DESCRIPTION:
You can use the Brave Slots by inserting 3 Brave Medals into the machine. Once the slots begin to spin, you will be awarded a prize depending on what pictures match up.

You can obtain Brave Medals by clearing Quests in Raid Battle.

A maximum of 9999 Brave Medals can be carried at a time.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1000_4_DESCRIPTION:
You can collect Merit Points you have earned through your Missions by accessing your Mission Record.

The entries in this section will be automatically marked as completed once their requirements have been fulfilled.

Special Challenges will award you more points than usual, but they must be manually selected from the Challenges menu.
Special Challenges are also often updated, so make sure to visit the Akras Summoners' Hall Administration Office often to check them out.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1000_5_DESCRIPTION:
Challenges are tests given out by the Akras Summoners' Hall.
Some of these challenges are time sensitive, and can be failed when not completed in the amount of time allotted.

There are challenges which can only be completed once, and will therefore become unavailable once completed.

The challenges available change from time to time, so make sure to visit the Akras Summoners' Hall Administration Office often to check them out.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1000_6_DESCRIPTION:
In the Trade menu, you can exchange eligible Units, Zel and Karma for Merit Points.
There is a limit as to how many Merit Points you can obtain in one day, so you will not be allowed to receive more than the amount allotted.

The higher the level of the Units you trade, or the higher their rarity, the more Merit Points you will receive in exchange for them.
*2-star Units or lower, Fusion, and Evolution Units are not eligible for Trade.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1000_7_DESCRIPTION:
You can spend your Merit Points at the Exchange Hall to obtain various Items and Units.

Each Item and Unit available in the Exchange Hall has a limit as to how many times it can be exchanged for. Some of them are also time sensitive offers, but may become available again in the future once their time has expired.

The Items and Units available in the Exchange Hall are updated from time to time to include limited edition content, so make sure to visit the Akras Summoners' Hall Administration Office often to check them out.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1000_8_DESCRIPTION:
When you complete a certain number of Challenges under Missions, Special Challenges (SP Challenges) will appear. You may only choose one SP Challenge out of the several that appear on screen. Any unselected Challenges will be discarded after one is chosen, so please keep in mind the difficulty of the Challenge and its rewards before settling on one.
If you tap the "Discard Challenges" button without choosing a SP Challenge, all SP Challenges will be discarded, and you will have to complete the required amount of regular Challenges before you're able to choose a SP Challenge again.
If you tap the "Back" button while the SP Challenges are on screen, once you return to that same screen the SP Challenges will be displayed yet again. However, you will be unable to select anything from the list of regular Challenges until you have either completed or given up on the SP Challenge you have chosen.
If you give up on any SP Challenge you have chosen, a new list of SP Challenges will not be displayed. If you would like to try a different SP Challenge, you will have to give up on your current SP Challenge and complete the required amount of regular Challenges before you're able to choose a SP Challenge again.
SP Challenges are not included in the number of regular Challenges you can accept at a time, so it is possible to take on 5 regular Challenges and 1 SP Challenge at the same time.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_10_DESCRIPTION:
A 7 star Unit can learn an Ultimate Brave Burst when its Super Brave Burst level reaches 10.

Ultimate Brave Bursts don't have levels and are maxed out when learned.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_11_DESCRIPTION:
A 7 star Unit can learn an Extra Skill when its Super Brave Burst level reaches 10.

Extra Skills activate under certain conditions.

Unlike Leader Skills, an Extra Skill can activate for a Unit that isn't the Leader.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_1_DESCRIPTION:
On the Manage Units screen, you can manage the Squads that will fight in the Arena or in Quests.

A Squad can be composed of a maximum of five Units.

The total cost of the selected Units cannot exceed your current cost limit.
The cost limit increases according to the player level.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_2_DESCRIPTION:
By fusing a unit with another unit, you can strengthen that Unit by raising its level.

You must have Zel and Material Units in order to Fuse Units.
Units used as fusion material disappear after use.

You can gain bonus XP by using Units of the same element as material.

If the material unit has a Sphere equipped, it will be unequipped automatically.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_3_DESCRIPTION:
When fusing Units, the base Unit's Brave Burst may level up if the Unit(s) used as fusion material has the same type of Brave Burst (Attack, Recovery, etc.).
When a Brave Burst levels up, its abilities increase.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_4_DESCRIPTION:
Some units may evolve. When a Unit is made to evolve, a more powerful Unit is born.
The following conditions must be met to make a Unit evolve:

- The Unit to be evolved must be at max level.
- You must have the Material Units required for Evolution.
- You must have the required amount of Zel.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_5_DESCRIPTION:
Some Units have Leader Skills. In order to active a Unit's Leader Skill, they must be selected as Leader.

Also, when you choose a friend as a Summon Helper, their Unit's Leader Skill is also activated.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_6_DESCRIPTION:
Each Unit has a type.
The unit type affects how its parameters increase when leveling up.

Lord: Balanced type
Anima: HP-oriented type
Breaker: Attack-oriented type
Guardian: Defense-oriented type
Oracle: Recovery-oriented type

A Unit's type can be confirmed on their Details screen. Similar Units may differ in their final abilities depending on their type.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_7_DESCRIPTION:
Units whose rarity is 6 or higher can learn a Super Brave Burst.

A 6 star Unit must attain a Brave Burst level of 10 to unlock their Super Brave Burst.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_8_DESCRIPTION:
When using the unit "Sphere Frog" as a material in Fusion, the sphere capacity of the base unit will increase.
You can only add 1 extra sphere per unit, so you cannot fuse 2 or more Sphere Frogs into 1 unit.

Those units who have increased their sphere capacity will inherit this trait even when they evolve.
However, even if you fuse them with other materials afterwards, their sphere capacity will not increase any further.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_100_9_DESCRIPTION:
"Imps" are special units that when used in fusion have the unique ability of increasing all of the base unit's status parameters. When using this material in fusion, parameters are influenced as listed below:

-Power Imp Pakpak: Atk +20
-Guard Imp Ganju: Def +20
-Healing Imp Fwahl: Rec +20
-Vigor Imp Molin: HP +50
*This stats increase will be shown on the right side of the status numbers provided for each unit in the Details screen.

Because there are status limits set, if a particular parameter goes over the allowed limit, Fusion will not take place.

Those units who have increased all of their parameters will inherit this trait even when they evolve.
However, even if you fuse them with other materials afterwards, their overall parameters will not increase any further.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1100_1_DESCRIPTION:
Unlike normal battles, in Trials you can use up to three Squads in a single Quest.

If one Squad is defeated the next Squad is automatically summoned, and you must defeat the enemy before all your Squads have been defeated to clear the Quest.

For this Quest, Gems cannot be used to revive your Squad after they have been defeated.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1100_2_DESCRIPTION:
You have access to two times your normal Cost which you can divide between up to three Squads.

During battle, Squads will be summoned in the order in which they were selected.

A Leader must be assigned in each Squad, and Squads without a leader will not be summoned.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1100_3_DESCRIPTION:
One Helper Summoner can be selected for each Squad.

In Trials, only Friends can be selected as Summoner Helpers.

Your Friends' Leader Skills take effect on each party they are summoned with.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_10_DESCRIPTION:
To judge how many Service Points you'll be awarded, an evaluation of your performance during each Quest will be displayed by a number of stars on the screen. Besides the amount of points you get for defeating a Target, the use of Raid Items will also affect your score.

- Defeating a Target (Example: defeat Edelma, defeat Van Lucy, etc.)

100 × (Amount of damage one dealt to boss ÷ damage dealt to boss as a group.)

- Item Usage

Number of Items used × 5

*Maximum amount of Item points that can be gained is 25pts (5 Items used total).
*Eligible Items are Beacon, God Crystal, Atk Crystal, and Def Crystal.

- According to the number of points you gain from the two terms evaluated above, your overall score will be calculated as follows:

★★★★★　400pts or more
★★★★　　 300 - 399pts
★★★　　　 200 - 299pts
★★　　　　 101 - 199pts
★　　　　　　 0 - 100pts
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_11_DESCRIPTION:
Depending on how many stars you receive for your overall score, you will be entitled to different types of rewards.

- Zel, Karma, and Medal Bonus
★★★★★ ×　1.30
★★★★　　× 1.20
★★★　　 × 1.10
★★　　　　 × 1.05
★　　　　　 × 1.00 (in general)

- Item Drop Bonus
★★★★★ ×　3.00
★★★★ ×　2.50
★★★　　 ×　2.00
★★　　　　 × 1.50
★　　　　　 × 1.00 (in general)
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_12_DESCRIPTION:
A Contribution Bonus will also be awarded based on how many members participated in the Quest.
*The Contribution Bonus will be added on top of the Service Points you receive for your overall performance during a Quest.

- Zel, Karma, and Medal Bonus
4 people ×　1.15
3 people ×　1.10
2 people ×　1.05
1 person ×　1.00 (in general)

- Item Drop Bonus
4 people ×　1.50
3 people ×　1.25

2 people ×　1.10
1 person ×　1.00 (in general)
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_1_DESCRIPTION:
In Raid Battles, a maximum of four players may battle together as a Team.
The conditions required to complete each Quest vary according to that particular mission, such as just defeating the boss, or having to defeat multiple enemies instead.
Raid Battles have a set time limit in which they must be completed. If you cannot complete the Quest in said time, it will be considered a failure, and you will be forced to abandon it.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_2_DESCRIPTION:
In order to participate in Raid Battles, you must join a Room.
A minimum of one player is required per Room, and a maximum of four may join at any given time.

The player who wants to open a Room will be the Room Master.
The Room Master can select which Quest to take part in.
Also, if the Room displays the sign "Expel On," this grants the Room Master the ability to expel any particular member of his or her choosing from the Team.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_3_DESCRIPTION:
Raid Classes (RC) increase after completing certain Quests.
When you go up a class you will receive a special reward.
You will also be able to participate in more challenging Quests as your RC increases.

However, you will only be able to participate in missions that correspond to your current RC.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_4_DESCRIPTION: To participate in a Raid Battle you will need to use one "Raid Orb." Raid Orbs regenerate after one hour has passed.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_5_DESCRIPTION:
Every player will have three Lives at the start of each Quest.
If your whole Squad falls during a Raid Battle, you will lose one Life, be sent back to the Camp, and your Units will start recovering HP.

If you're left with 0 Lives, you may choose "Recover Lives" to recover a single Life by using a Gem, or "Give Up" to stop participating in the Quest, resulting in its failure.
In addition, when there are multiple players participating, if any of them lose all of their Lives or give up, they will leave the Quest, but the remaining players can continue with their mission.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_6_DESCRIPTION:
You can "Rest" at your Camp.
When you Rest, your Units will gradually recover their HP.
Units which were knocked out will also recover their HP.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_7_DESCRIPTION:
In order to fight the Boss related to the mission, you must "Move" to its location on the map.
There are Quests which immediately show the location of the Boss, and some that do not.

However, even in the Quests where the Boss's location is not shown, you can use the exclusive Raid item "Detector" to find its hiding place.

Also, there are Bosses which will move around the map from time to time. In that case, you may fight the Boss in a particular location, but it may relocate to another afterwards.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_8_DESCRIPTION:
Some of the Bosses have different parts that compose them.

Each part has its own attributes, and different types of attacks that it can perform.
Though the Boss may be defeated when its main body is destroyed, it cannot be defeated by destroying a single limb alone.
However, destroying the various parts that compose a Boss exponentially increases your chances of obtaining valuable Items.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1200_9_DESCRIPTION:
In Raid Battles, there are certain locations on the map which allow you to "Harvest" materials.
Most of the items that you can Harvest here are exclusively for use during Raid Battles, but occasionally you can obtain valuable materials to create or exchange Spheres.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1300_1_DESCRIPTION:
You can create different Spheres than those available in the Town with materials obtained from Raid Battles.

In order to create a Sphere, you will need the materials required as well as sufficient Karma to complete the process.

To increase the variety of Spheres available, the key is to collect many different materials from Raid Battles.
Once you collect many different types of materials, more Spheres will be unlocked.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1400_1_DESCRIPTION:
You can Synthesize exclusive Raid Items to be used during battle.

In order to create an Item, you will need the required materials first.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_1_DESCRIPTION:
Grand Quest is a huge group of Quests that multiple Squads go on.

The story separates into branches depending on your actions, so multiple endings are possible.

Also, some Quests have different conditions for clearing.

You can access Grand Quest via the Quest button on the Home screen.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_2_DESCRIPTION:
Each Quest in Grand Quest has a required number of Squads.

If you can't create the required number, you can't go on that Quest.

Each quest also has a set limit for the total Cost of your Squads.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_3_DESCRIPTION:
For each Squad, you can select one Friend's Leader Unit to be the your Helper Summoner.

Only Friends can be selected.

The Friend's Leader Skill will be active for that Squad only.

If "Guest" or "Reserved" appears in a Squad's Friend spot, you can't select a Friend for that Squad.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_4_DESCRIPTION:
Clear a Quest while fulfilling certain requirements to raise your Percent Complete.

Once you raise it, it won't go down.

Tap Requirements to see which requirements you have met so far.

You'll get a special reward at 100%.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_5_DESCRIPTION:
During a Quest, tap Pause and then Yes to save your progress and return to the Home screen.

To start your Quest from where you left off, select Quest on the Home screen and tap Grand Quest, followed by Yes when prompted.

Tap No when prompted if you want to delete your save data and go on a different Quest.

While Grand Quest is paused, you can access any other feature of the game, such as regular Quest, Raid Battle, Arena, Summon, etc.

*If you Fuse Units, etc. while a Quest is paused, it won't be reflected in that Quest.

*Only one Quest's save data can be saved at a time. If you pause a Quest, the saved data from the last time you paused will be overwritten, so please be careful.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_6_DESCRIPTION:
Quest Clear rewards vary depending on your actions during that Quest.

Some Quest Clear rewards can only be claimed once whereas others have no limit.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_7_DESCRIPTION:
On the Map there are icons for Bosses and powerful Enemies. Move to one to start a battle.

There are also icons that indicate an event will occur if you meet special conditions.

Some routes are locked, indicated by a door icon. You can open them by meeting certain conditions.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_8_DESCRIPTION:
The currently selected Squad is indicated by a gold icon.

You can select a different Squad by tapping Squad on the lower right.

When you tap a point on the map, the Squad that can reach that location will move there.

If a point on the Map is grayed out, you can't move there.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_1700_9_DESCRIPTION:
You can reread any Quest stories you have cleared in Grand Quest at the Imperial Library. You can access the Imperial Library from the Imperial Capital Randall icon available in the Home screen, and then tapping on the Imperial Library building.
You can only reread stories that you have already cleared in Grand Quest. If you pause your current GQ Quest, fail it, or give up, you will not be able to see its story through the Imperial Library.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_200_1_DESCRIPTION:
Use Manage Items to configure the Items you carry with you on Quests.

A maximum of 5 types of Items can be carried on Quests, and the quantity you can carry differs by Item.

Items cannot be created during Quests.
Items sets can also be configured from the screen before you begin a Quest.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_200_2_DESCRIPTION:
Spheres are equipment that strengthen a Unit's abilities. Spheres can have a variety of effects, from raising abilities to providing resistance to status effects.

Only 1 Sphere can be equipped to each Unit.

If a Unit equipped with a Sphere is sold or used as material in fusion or evolution, the Sphere will automatically be unequipped.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_200_3_DESCRIPTION:
There are 12 different types of spheres with different effects.
You may not equip two spheres of the same type at the same time.

Examples of Corresponding Sphere Types
-Status Boost Type
Famous Blade, Muramasa

-Critical Type
Champion Axe, Death Axe

-Drop Type
Skill Bracer, Thief Bracer

-Status Ailment Type
Venom Knives, Demon Rifle

-Status Ailments Resistant Types
Poison Light, Faint Light

-BB Gauge Type
Star Blade, Evil Shard

-HP Recovery Type
Divine Crest, Cursed Robe

-Expose Target Type
Clear Cloak, Wise Mask

-Damage Reflecting Type
Glass Crown

-Damage Reducing Type
Monster Robe

-Spark Type
Royal Bud

-Defense Penetrating Type
Demon Lance
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_300_1_DESCRIPTION:
When you add another player as a Friend, you'll both get a variety of benefits.

- When a friend is selected as a Summoner Helper, you get the added effect of their Leader Unit's Leader Skill.
- You can get more Honor Pts when you hire a friend as a Summoner Helper.
- You can give each other Gifts.

Friend requests can be made after completing Quests or when searching by Player ID.

The maximum number of Friends you can have increases with your player level.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_300_2_DESCRIPTION:
Friends can give each other Gifts once a day.

Send a gift by selecting an Item, Zel, Karma, or Honor Pts.
Items sent as Gifts are not taken from the player's inventory, so go ahead and send your Friends exactly what they want.

Only 200 Gifts can be held at once. As new Gifts are received, old Gifts are replaced in the order in which they arrived. Be sure to check and receive your Gifts regularly.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_300_3_DESCRIPTION:
Make note of particular Gifts you want on your Gift Wishlist.

Select the "Friend's who want this" checkbox to display Friends who have added a certain Item to their Wishlist. You should always send Items your Friends have registered on their Wishlists.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_400_1_DESCRIPTION:
Get on Quests by selecting Area > Dungeon > Quest.

When all of the Quests in a Dungeon are completed that Dungeon is marked Clear, then a new Dungeon will appear. The Area is completed when all Dungeons in it have been cleared, at which time the next Area will be unlocked if there is one. Areas are unlocked sequentially.

Areas can be changed by flicking left or right.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_400_2_DESCRIPTION:
Energy is consumed during Quests. Each Quest requires a different amount of Energy. Energy gradually recovers with time.

XP builds up as Quests are completed, and when the player receives a certain amount they level up.
When a player levels up, their Energy, Cost limit, and Friend limit increase.

Also, Energy and Arena Orbs are fully recovered when leveling up.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_400_3_DESCRIPTION:
You can select one Summoner Helper to join you in battle when you go on a Quest.
Unit's whose help you enlist won't show up on the list again for a certain period of time.

If the help of a Friend's Unit is enlisted, you also receive the effect of that Unit's Leader Skill.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_500_1_DESCRIPTION:
Vortex Gates allow players to enter Special Dungeons that only appear on certain days or for a limited time.

These Dungeons allow players to get normally difficult-to-obtain Units, lots of Zel or Karma, or materials all in fun and interesting to play Quests.

There are some Dungeons where players can also get extremely valuable Units, so be sure to check for new Dungeons regularly.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_10_DESCRIPTION:
Each Unit has an Element, each of which has its own strength and weakness.

[Fire/Water/Earth/Thunder]
These elements have the following relationships.
- Fire is strong against Earth, but weak to Water.
- Earth is strong against Thunder, but weak to Fire.
- Thunder is strong against Water, but weak to Earth.
- Water is strong against Fire, but weak to Thunder.

When a Unit attacks an enemy of an Element against which it is strong, damage increases. In the opposite case, the damage is decreased.

[Light / Dark]
Light and Dark oppose each other, so when Light attacks Dark or vice versa, the damage will be greater than normal.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_11_DESCRIPTION:
The following status effects can be afflicted during battle.

- Poison: HP decreases every turn.
- Weak: Defense decreases.
- Sick: Recovery ability decreases.
- Injury: Attack power decreases.
- Paralysis: Causes immobility for a fixed number of turns.
- Curse: Causes the BB gauge to stop charging, making Brave Bursts unavailable.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_12_DESCRIPTION:
During battle, you can see any status effects currently active represented by an icon floating over a Unit.

When multiple status effects are in place at once, the icon will change from one status to another intermittently to display them all.

To see all status effects currently active, press and hold a Unit to open a window at the bottom of the screen which will display them, as well as those ready to be refurbished.

You will only have access to this screen at the start of your turn (during the same time you can use Items).

Status effects for all Units (including enemies) can be shown by tapping on the desired Unit in this screen.

Also, if you tap on the left or right arrows, you can change which group's information you'd like to see (enemy or ally).

For more information about what each icon stands for, please refer to "Status Effects" under the Help section in the Menu.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_13_DESCRIPTION: If game performance slows down during battle, you can fix this by turning off various effects in display settings.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_14_DESCRIPTION:
Units who learned an Ultimate Brave Burst can activate it after activating Overdrive.

See the Overdrive section for details.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_15_DESCRIPTION:
Only Units with Ultimate Brave Bursts can activate Overdrive.

Even if there are multiple Units in a Squad with Ultimate Brave Bursts, only 1 can activate Overdrive at a time.

Overdrive has the effects described below:

-Greatly boosts Atk, Def, Rec

-Enables Ultimate Brave Burst

-Disables Brave Burst, Super Brave Burst

Once active, Overdrive lasts until you activate Ultimate Brave Burst or 3 turns pass.

How to Activate Overdrive

An Overdrive gauge appears for Units with an Ultimate Brave Burst. You can fill it by:

-Completing turns

-Performing regular attacks

-Activating Brave Burst

-Attacking weaker elements

When the Overdrive gauge fills up, swipe left over a Unit with an Ultimate Brave Burst to activate its Overdrive.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_16_DESCRIPTION:
Tap Auto during battle to turn the mode on or off.

To turn the following Auto Battle settings on or off, tap Menu > Settings:

-Auto Claim Treasure

-Auto Brave Burst

-Super Brave Burst Priority

-Healing Brave Burst Priority
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_1_DESCRIPTION:
During a battle, touch a Unit's Action Button at the bottom of the screen to have the corresponding Unit attack.

When all of your allied Units have finished their attack, it will be the enemy's turn.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_2_DESCRIPTION:
Touch the enemy you want to attack to put target and lock on to a specific enemy.

When an enemy is selected, their health gauge and elemental weakness will appear on the sceen.

Once an enemy is targeted the target doesn't change even after the enemy has been defeated. This is important to remember when attempting Overkill.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_3_DESCRIPTION:
Brave Burst (BB) is the special skill that each Unit has.

Brave Bursts can be triggered after the Brave Burst gauge becomes full. It fills up when Units absorb Battle Crystals that appear when attacking enemies during battle.

Once a Unit's Brave Burst can be triggered, put your finger on their Action button and drag diagonally up and to the right to unleash it.

Holding your finger on a Unit's Action Button will display information about their Brave Burst. You can cancel a Brave Burst or even a normal attack by simply releasing your finger without moving it.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_4_DESCRIPTION:
Put your finger on a Unit's Action Button and slide it down to have your Unit Guard.

When guarding, damage taken from an enemy is drastically reduced, but the Unit cannot attack or perform a Brave Burst during that turn.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_5_DESCRIPTION:
Enemies drop Battle Crystals (BC) and Heart Crystals (HC) when attacked. Dropped crystals are absorbed randomly by each Unit at the end of a turn.

The following effects can be obtained from acquiring crystals:
- Battle Crystals increase a Unit's Brave Burst gauge.
- Heart Crystals increase a fixed amount of a Unit's HP.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_6_DESCRIPTION:
During battle, touch the icon of the Item you wish to use at the bottom of the screen, then select a Unit, or Units, to use that Item.

Items can only be used at the beginning of a turn. Once a Unit has performed an action, Items can no longer be used during that turn.

Only the Items configured into your Item set before battle can be used during battle.
Don't forget to manage your Items before starting a Quest.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_7_DESCRIPTION:
Sparks occur when multiple Units cause damage to the same enemy at the same time whilst attacking.

When a Spark is triggered, it causes more damage than normal.

Work on your Unit order as well as your tap timing to produce more Sparks and inflict more damage.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_8_DESCRIPTION:
Overkill occurs when additional attacks are made on an enemy after if has already fallen to 0 HP.

Perform Overkill for a high probability of producing more Battle Crystals. This is very effective when you want to gather BC quickly.

Overkill is easy to do when using the target feature.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_600_9_DESCRIPTION:
Treasure Chests sometimes appear when enemies are defeated. Touch a Treasure Chest after a battle to see what's inside.

However, some Treasure Chests contain vicious monsters, so be careful.

If you don't want to open a Treasure Chest, simply tap Advance to proceed to the next screen.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_700_1_DESCRIPTION:
There are four gathering points in Village of the Venturer: Farm, Mountain, Forest, and River.

Tap each terrain when it lights up to harvest various Items from it.

Once an area has been harvested, it can't be harvested again for 3 hours.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_700_2_DESCRIPTION:
Use Karma to upgrade your facilities and gathering points.

When upgrading gathering points, the types of Items that can be obtained from each location and the amount gathered per tap increases.

Upgrade the Synthesis House and the Sphere House to add new types of Items to create.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_700_3_DESCRIPTION:
Here you can synthesize consumable Items for use in battle.

To synthesize an Item, you must have the materials required for synthesis.

Upgrade your Synthesis House in Facility Upgrades to unlock new Items to synthesize.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_700_4_DESCRIPTION:
Create Spheres to enhance Unit abilities when equipped.

To create a Sphere, you must have the materials and Karma required for Sphere creation.

Upgrade your Sphere House in Facility Upgrades to unlock new Spheres to synthesize.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_700_5_DESCRIPTION:
Here you can listen to all the BGM from Brave Frontier. Zel is required to unlock BGM.

You must complete Quests to add new BGM to the line-up.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800000_1_DESCRIPTION:
Summoners will be divided into Level Tier, according to the following level range:
- Lv 15 to Lv 24
- Lv 25 to Lv 34
- Lv 35 to Lv 44
- Lv 45 to Lv 54
- Lv 55 to Lv 74
- Lv 75 and above

In each Level Tier, you will be allocated to a random group, to compete for rank within the group.

Become top ranker within the group and get great rewards!
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800000_2_DESCRIPTION:
You can get Victory Points by participating in Quest, Vortex events and Arena.

During the tournament, some dungeons in Quest and Vortex will give victory points upon completion. The points gained from Quest are scaled based on the difficulty of the area.

Arena Battle will give Victory Points upon winning or losing. Points acquired upon winning will be calculated based on Arena Battle Points gained.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800000_3_DESCRIPTION:
Summoners will be ranked within a group, based on the number of Victory Points acquired.

At the end of the tournament, summoner who reaches the top rank will be able to claim various rewards.

Current tournament rewards includes Exclusive Spheres, Burst Frogs, Metal Gods and many more!

Details of rewards for each tier can be seen from Victory Tournament Main Page.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800_1_DESCRIPTION:
The Arena is a combat stadium where players can test their skill in battle against each other.

Each battle consumes one Arena Orb.
Arena Orbs recover once per hour.

Your Summoner Rank increases with each Arena victory, and you can get special rewards when you level up.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800_2_DESCRIPTION:
During an Arena battle, all Units attack automatically. Players cannot control anything during battle.

Victory goes to the Squad able to knock out all members of the opposing Squad within the time limit.

If one of the teams is not annihilated within the time limit, the the winning team will be decided according to the following sequence of conditions:
- The team with the greater number of surviving Units.
- The team with the greatest remaining HP.
- The team that inflicted the greatest total damage.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800_3_DESCRIPTION:
Arena Battle Points (ABP) increase with victories in Arena battles and decrease with defeats.

Get more ABP by defeating players with a higher ABP rank than that of your own. You must also be careful as you will lose more ABP if you lose to an opponent whose rank is lower than your own.

ABP only goes up or down when a player attempts a battle. Even if a player is attacked and loses, their ABP don't change (Though it will be recorded in your Battle Record as a win or loss).
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800_4_DESCRIPTION:
Increase your Summoner Rank by accumulating a certain amount of ABP.

You will get a special reward when you reach a new rank for the first time, so aim to rank up by actively participating in Arena battles.

Your rank can go down if you lose once more after reaching 0 ABP, so be careful.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800_5_DESCRIPTION: If the App terminates during an Arena battle, it counts as an automatic loss.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800_6_DESCRIPTION:
Depending on your victory conditions, actions in battle, and win streak, you can get Bonus Points added to your Arena Battle Points.

Victory Conditions
-You won with fewer Units than your opponent.
-None of your units were knocked out. *You'll get even more Bonus Points if your Units have max HP or BB gauges.

Actions in Battle
-Your Units beat via their weaknesses (e.g. Fire beat Earth).
-Your Units used Brave Bursts.
-You beat more than 1 Unit in a turn. *Bonus Points are based on max damage per turn. If you beat 2 Units in a turn and then beat 3 in the next turn, the later turn's Bonus Points will count.

Win Streak

Win 3 battles in a row to start getting Bonus Points. You'll get more Bonus Points with each consecutive win, until the 10th. From then on, you'll get the same number of Bonus Points.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_800_7_DESCRIPTION:
If you turn Random Rules on before starting an Arena battle, there is a chance that one will apply. If you win with a Random Rule applied, you'll get Bonus Points.
*Random Rules aren't guaranteed to apply even if they are turned on.

Below are the Random Rules that may apply:
*They apply to both you and your opponent.
-Empty BB Gauge Start
-No Brave Bursts
-Atk Parameter Halved
-Status Effects Active
-Fire Element Advantage
- Water Element Advantage
-Earth Element Advantage
-Thunder Element Advantage
-Light Element Advantage
-Dark Element Advantage
-Male Unit Advantage
-Female Unit Advantage
-
-Genderless Unit Advantage
No Leader Skills
-No Sphere Effects
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_900000_1_DESCRIPTION:
Earn Brave Points (BP) by completing Daily Tasks to redeem great prizes and earn loyalty milestone rewards!

- Everyday your Daily Tasks will be Refreshed with 3 new tasks
- Uncompleted tasks from the previous day will be forfieted
- Completing all 3 tasks of the day will earn you 20 bonus BP!
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_900000_2_DESCRIPTION:
Arena Victory - Achieve 4 Victories in the Arena
Quest Explorer - Complete 5 Missions within
Vortex Venturer - Complete 5 Missions within the Vortex
Power Up - Fuse 20 units
Unit Upgrade - Evolve any units 3 times
Craftsman - Craft 20 Items/Spheres
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_900000_3_DESCRIPTION:
Prize Redemption -- Redeem items and prizes with your current amount of earned BPs

Milestone Rewards -- Automatically unlock loyalty milestone rewards with your total BPs collected. Claim your rewards by visiting the Milestone Rewards page.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_900_1_DESCRIPTION:
Search the frontier and receive various rewards based on the results of your search.
The Survey Office is open for fixed periods of time, at the end of which your Hunter Rank will increase according to the record you achieve.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_900_2_DESCRIPTION:
When going on Quests from the Survey Office, though you can't take normal items with you, you are provided special Items from the Akras Summoners' Hall.
Unused items are collected at the end of a Quest, so please use them freely.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_900_3_DESCRIPTION:
Hunter Rank (HR) increases according to how much Frontier Service you rack up during the survey period.
*Please claim your rewards from the Survey Office after a survey period ends but before the next begins.
Please be aware that if you don't claim your rewards before the next survey begins they will be removed.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_900_4_DESCRIPTION:
Each Quest consumes 1 Hunter Orb.
Hunter Orbs recover 1 every three hours.
When Hunter Orbs have run out, tap the Participate button and you'll be given the option to use 1 Gem to restore your orbs.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_900_5_DESCRIPTION:
Your Frontier Service increases depending on how many Esteem pts you rack up on Quests from the Survey Office.
Your Frontier Service increases at a faster rate when you challenge more difficult Quests.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_910_1_DESCRIPTION:
You can access Frontier Gate from the Survey Office in the Imperial Capital Randall.
Each Quest will consume 1 Hunter Orb. You can receive many different rewards depending on how many Quests you clear, and how many Service and or Training Points you accumulate.
You cannot bring the Items you have usually equipped on your Frontier Gate Quests.

Every time you win 5 battles in Frontier Gate, you will have 3 choices available on how to proceed: "Continue," "Pause," or "Retire."
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_910_2_DESCRIPTION:
Every time you win 5 battles in Frontier Gate, you will have 3 choices available on how to proceed: "Continue," "Pause," or "Retire."

・Continue
You can continue fighting with the same amount of remaining HP, BB gauge, and OD gauge, as well as with any status effects that were still active on your last turn.
However, if your Squad falls in battle before you are able to win the next 5 battles, you will not be able to claim any rewards for that particular Quest.
The difficulty level of each Quest also rises slightly every time you choose to continue.

・Pause
This choice will save your current position, allowing you to continue from the same point whenever you decide to resume the same Quest.

・Retire
When you retire, you can collect all rewards available based on how many battles you won and how many Service Points you accumulated during your Quest.
However, the next time you attempt the same Quest you will have to start again from the beginning.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_910_3_DESCRIPTION:
Before your Quest starts, you will be able to select either one Friend to help you, or a Unit of your own to aid you on the battlefield.
Once you have chosen a Helper Unit, you cannot change it until you retire.
entries.MST_HELP_SUBTOPIC_910_4_DESCRIPTION:
Before you set off on your first battle, Noel will provide you with special support. After you have won 5 battles, you will be able to choose a new type of Support if you decide to continue.
However, you can only receive one type of Support at a time, so any new choice you make will render Noel's previous Support invalid.

There are many different types of Support available, such as parameter boosts for your Units, or Item Sets for use in battle.
